f7ed480f-13cf-4cbe-9681-5a096540d176.description: Workshop participants will focus on developing communication and collaboration skills to enhance their ability to foster diversity in professional settings. Participants will learn how to respond more effectively to problems involving diversity in interpersonal relationships and within groups and communities. They will also be able to use their knowledge and skills to build more inclusive work environments. Participants will earn a Safe Zone LinkedIn badge upon completion of the workshop.
f7ed480f-13cf-4cbe-9681-5a096540d176.name: Safe Zone Training

alignments.name: The Safe Zone Project
alignments.description: The Safe Zone Project, serving over 25,000 educators in over 100 countries, has developed a free online resource to provide education to individuals about topics of sexuality, gender, and LGBTQ+ issues.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete and analyze diversity self-profiling assessment to reveal self identities and how they fit into the scope of intersectionality. Participants leverage self-awareness of these strengths to understand and evaluate potential roles as employees, team members, and emerging leaders in the workplace.

Develop and enhance interpersonal communication. Participants will be able to adapt their communication skills to a more diverse population to assist in developing an inclusive work environment for employers.
Advocate for a diverse environment. Participants will understand different strategies for cultivating a progressive mentality for team success.

a775b686-646b-4819-a934-d9eb8c7e0d24.description: Earners of this badge have successfully completed Merrimack College's Professional Development Retreat, developing necessary skills around communication and collaboration. They can engage in productive discussion and resolution of issues with their colleagues and managers. Earners can effectively communicate across difference and can pursue interpersonal networking.
a775b686-646b-4819-a934-d9eb8c7e0d24.name: Professional Communication and Collaboration: Professional Development Retreat

alignments.name: NACE Career Readiness Competencies
alignments.description: The National Association of Colleges and Employers, through a task force of college career services and HR/staffing professionals, has developed a definition, based on extensive research among employers, and identified eight competencies associated with career readiness.

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion the 2-day Merrimack College Professional Development Retreat.

Earners work in a small group to solve and then present three workplace solutions to industry judges. These challenges are focused around conflict management and resolution, effective communication, leadership, collaboration, giving feedback, emotion management, and managing up to superiors.

Earners develop, articulate and present a professional pitch. Earners craft talking points for individual strengths that showcase experiences and connect skills and strengths to what employers seek when hiring. Earners practice their pitch with peers and industry experts in small groups and large group settings.

Earners enhance their personal communication skills and build confidence through a 90-minute workshop on interpersonal networking. Earner's discover the professional neuanes of a networking environment. Earners are able to successfully enter and exit conversations in a professional and compelling manner. Earners understand the importance of and benefit to building social capital.

Earners engage with prestigious Merrimack College alumni, College Leadership Council members, Board of Trustees members, industry professionals, and employers in a social networking environment. Earners are able to make and articulate their strengths and make connections between their strengths and professional experiences.

Earners participate in a Skills Fair with over 20 companies, drawing on personal skills, strengths, experiences and professional pitch to communicate, connect and network with employers. Earners make connections with new companies beyond those that may typically fall within their major and industry.

d61a4545-f56c-4e1e-9a67-3aacb5141b3e.description: Participants of this badge will have successfully completed Merrimack College's Diversity Awareness Training. Participants will develop fundamental skills around communication, collaboration, and professionalism within diversity, equity, and inclusion. Participants can draw upon the skills to articulate a more conscious response to interpersonal relationship and diversity responsiveness. All skills learned will assist to build a more inclusive work environment for potential employers.
d61a4545-f56c-4e1e-9a67-3aacb5141b3e.name: Diversity Awareness Training

alignments.name: Adams, M., Bell, L. & Griffin, P. (2007). Teaching for Diversity and Social Justice. New York, NY: Routledge.
Goodman, D. J. (2015) Oppression and Privilege: Two Sides of the Same Coin. Journal of Intercultural Communication. No 18. pp 1-14.
Johnson, A.G. (2018). Privilege, Power and Difference.Third edition. New York, NY: McGraw-Hill Education.
Kirwan Institute for the Study of Race & Ethnicity
Teaching Tolerance: Test Yourself for Hidden Bias
Gurin, P. Nagda, B.R.A, Zuniga, X. (2013). Dialogue Across Difference: Practice, Theory and Research on Intergroup Dialogue. New York, NY: Russell Sage Foundation.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete four workshops. Workshop 1: Building a Foundation, with topics of Building Blocks of Dialogue, Social Identity Group Categories and Intersectionality. Workshop 2: Socialization, with topics of Socialization, Stereotype, Prejudice, Discrimination, Implicit Bias, Microagressions. Workshop 3: Power and Privilege, with topics of Power, Difference, Race/Ethnicity, Class, Privilege, Levels of Oppression. Workshop 4: Allyship and Activism.

Develop and enhance interpersonal and interpersonal communication. Participants will be able to adapt their communications skills to a more diverse population to assist in developing an inclusive work environment for employers

Attend at least one event through the Merrimack College Interdisciplinary Institute or a sponsored campus event that relates to the topics of diversity and inclusion. Participants will submit a reflection paper on their experiences of attending said event.
Collaborate in a series of team development exercises. Participants will work with fellow cohort members to foster new methods of working in diverse environments

Complete final assessment project. Participants will find solutions to solving systematic problems associated with a particular environment given to them. Participants will present a plan of action using and highlighting topics learned throughout the program.

fa1dfcd3-7a7d-41dd-8006-aeec0b99f63a.description: A Success Coach serves as a mentor, navigator, and point person for Merrimack students. Participants engaged in holistic cross-training workshops to develop strategies for supporting first-year students. Workshop participants focus on developing communication and collaboration skills to provide enhanced support and resources to first-year students.
fa1dfcd3-7a7d-41dd-8006-aeec0b99f63a.name: Success Coach: College Transition

alignments.name: Professional Competency Areas for Student Affairs Educators
alignments.description: The Advising and Supporting competency area addresses the knowledge, skills, and dispositions related to providing advising and support to individuals and groups through direction, feedback, critique, referral, and guidance.

badge_template_activities.title: Participants attend two 75 minute trainings to learn Slate (MC Connect), a customer relationship (CRM) tool used to manage student interactions across multiple Merrimack offices. Slate is a comprehensive platform for student success designed and developed exclusively for higher education and provides Success Coaches with a single, unified interface to track and support student success.

Participants engage in one 75 minute workshop on motivational interviewing, a student centered counseling technique to elicit behavior change by helping students explore and resolve ambivalence. This workshop covered the principles of motivational interviewing, characteristics, strategies, spirit, and skills associated with helping students be self-directed and make wanted changes in their behaviors.

Participants attend two 75 minute trainings to develop the knowledge, skills, and dispositions related to providing advising, support, and referring students to mental health counseling at the college. Participants learn how to frame mental health counseling to help students overcome the stigma of mental health help.

Participants are also cross-trained in campus-wide resources including the Tutoring and Math Center, Writing Center, Campus Wide Tutoring, and the Merrimack Study Partners Program. Participants develop skills needed to navigate student advising and registration. Additionally, participants learn how to support neurodiverse students and are trained on how to refer students to the Accessibility Services Office at Merrimack.

Participants complete two, one-hour, LinkedIn Learning courses. Participants who complete "Communicating with Empathy" learn the principles of empathetic communication and strategies to approaching difficult conversations.  Participants who complete "Coaching for Results" learn different techniques to improve performance, develop careers, and encourage high performers and get results.

Participants attend one two-hour diversity, equity, inclusion and the College Experience workshop to learn strategies to enhance students experiences and success on campus. The interactive workshop guides participants through a discussion of issues and challenges, including implicit bias, micro-aggressions, and resistance to diversity, equity and inclusion.

f779749b-2a72-43fa-b93f-872e13992658.description: A Success Coach serves as a mentor, navigator, and point person for Merrimack students. Workshop participants are exposed to career development tools, technology, and strategies. Participants discover critical career development milestones and learn how to leverage resources, and collaborate with faculty and staff to support students in achieving their long-term career goals.
f779749b-2a72-43fa-b93f-872e13992658.name: Success Coach: Career Development

alignments.name: NACE Competencies
alignments.description: Career readiness is a foundation from which to demonstrate requisite core competencies that broadly prepare the college educated student for success in the workplace and lifelong career management. NACE provides a framework for addressing career-related goals and outcomes of curricular and extracurricular activities, regardless of field of study.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners explore career development technology tools and resources to guide students toward a successful career journey. Earners are able to help students consider progress and position for career planning and skill development, to identify specific career goals, and how to craft a plan on how to reach their goals.

Earners discover tips and tricks to creating an exceptional resume that can beat the applicant tracking system (ATS). Earners are able to understand basic resume formatting practices, employer expectations, and techniques for developing competitive ATS and recruiter compatible resumes.

Earners explore common career development misconceptions and examine resources to supporting student's in their efforts to secure internships, co-ops, and job opportunities. Earners are introduced to the O'Brien Center's career milestone cheat sheets. Cheat sheets are designed to provide a framework for advising students on career development, specific to their major, for a successful transition from college to career.

Through scenarios, earners work in small groups to apply the career development knowledge they have gained to solve case studies. Earners pilot how to leverage career development resources, the technology at their disposal, identifying transferable skills, and other career management techniques that will benefit students when applying and interviewing for internships and jobs.

745933a6-ccd2-4e22-af8c-cfb2f04a9703.description: Participants who earn this badge have successfully completed the Autism Training at Merrimack College hosted by the Winston School of Education and Social Policy. They have demonstrated growth in knowledge about Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD), awareness of the challenges that people with ASD face, and acquired basic communication skills around these challenges.
745933a6-ccd2-4e22-af8c-cfb2f04a9703.name: Autism Spectrum Disorder Awareness

alignments.name: DESE High Quality Professional Development
alignments.description: A set of coherent learning experiences that is systematic, purposeful, and structured over a sustained period of time with the goal of improving teacher practice and student outcomes.

badge_template_activities.title: Participants first define ASD and its characteristics. They then discuss and practice communication skills to connect more effectively in a classroom or community setting to people with ASD, their families, and their caregivers.
Participants display a commitment to continued learning about ASD as active and engaged participants in dialogue and networking with workshop facilitators and fellow workshop attendees.

Participants complete reflection forms to demonstrate an understanding of the material and propose how they will incorporate a new understanding of the ASD community into their daily lives and workplaces.

1d2120ca-9259-48c6-9a2b-bfc01b2baf08.description: Earners focus on developing communication and collaboration skills that enhance their ability to support a wide diversity of students. Earners learn new techniques for integrating diversity and inclusion into their success coaching practice. Earners discover tools to facilitate collaboration among all perspectives on campus. Earners will learn different points of view to enhance support for students, faculty, and staff from underrepresented groups.
1d2120ca-9259-48c6-9a2b-bfc01b2baf08.name: Success Coach: Diversity & Inclusion

alignments.name: NASPA Competencies
alignments.description: The Advising and Supporting competency area addresses the knowledge, skills, and dispositions related to providing advising and support to individuals and groups through direction, feedback, critique, referral, and guidance.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners attended a 60 minute, live workshop, where issues related to diversity and inclusion were introduced and discussed as related to student support and success. Earners learned techniques for recognizing bias, using inclusive language for a diverse population of students, and holistic support practices that foster diversity and inclusion.

Earners attended a 75 minutes, live webinar, or viewed the recording of the live webinar. This interactive discussion addressed the role of the Neurodiversity Paradigm in standing up against ableism. The speaker, an Autistic Speech Therapist,  incorporated her personal experience to discuss blatant and concealed acts of ableism aimed at Neurodivergent individuals.

Earners attended a 75 minute, live webinar or viewed the webinar recording. Earners learned new methods for fostering inclusion and empathy in the workplace and while supporting students. Earners can create, build, and maintain a culture of inclusion through everyday empathetic actions.

Earners attended a 60 minute workshop on recognizing family privilege. Earners can recognize the critical role trusted and supportive caregivers and a stable environment are to students' learning and growing. Earners can define and identify family privilege - the often invisible benefits that accompany membership in a stable family. Earners conducted self-reflection on their experiences with family privilege and worked through scenarios on how to best support students experiencing crisis.

Earners attended a 60 minute workshop discussion on addressing difficult conversations with students and families to facilitate student progress and foster student growth. Earners learned how to address difficult topics and conversations with students while respecting and recognizing diversity. Earners discussed recognizing positions of privilege and power dynamics in conflict, and identified solutions to create equality and a respectful path to move forward.

38693c14-0e40-4e58-a53b-ad8d936edad2.description: The Distinguished Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Educator badge recognizes engagement of faculty, staff, and graduate students in personal and professional DEI-focused learning by encouraging participation with ongoing education and training. Examples may include Unity in Diversity Days and DEI courses through Academic Impressions. Focus will be on mastering of DEI vocabulary and skills and developing awareness related to inclusive excellence, institutional access, and diversity leadership.
38693c14-0e40-4e58-a53b-ad8d936edad2.name: Distinguished Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) Educator

alignments.name: NADOHE Standards of Professional Practice for CDOs in Higher Education, 2.0

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must complete a minimum of 25 hours of personal and/or professional education and training, where issues or learning outcomes focus on diversity, equity, and inclusion topics. Earners are able to articulate a basic understanding of and commitment to DEI and apply it into their work.

Earners have actively engaged in the pursuit of continued learning within the past two years, seeking out a mix of educational and training based opportunities. Earners actively engaged through attendance and/or participation as panelist/moderator at Merrimack’s Unity in Diversity Days events in Fall or Spring. Earners attend four Unity in Diversity Day sessions.

Earners demonstrate ability to utilize resources and skills to help create visible advocacy for diversity, equity, and inclusion in various Merrimack spaces. Earners help foster an inclusive workplace and campus through shared learning with colleagues and community.

Earners complete a diversity self-assessment and reflect on learning achievements, as well as gaps. Earners document knowledge and mastery of skills as it relates to themes of inclusive excellence, institutional access, and diversity leadership.

6e059d2b-a66a-4292-ab1e-a8fde3ea0a22.description: Merrimack College Mental Health First Aid for Youth is primarily designed for adults who regularly interact with young people. This 6-hour training teaches adults who work with youth techniques to reach out and provide initial support to children and adolescents (ages 6-18) who may be developing a mental health or substance use problem and help connect them to the appropriate care.
6e059d2b-a66a-4292-ab1e-a8fde3ea0a22.name: Mental Health First Aid - Youth Certification

alignments.name: Research & Evidence Base
alignments.description: Mental Health First Aid is an international training program proven to be effective. Studies also show that the program reduces the social distance created by negative attitudes and perceptions of individuals with mental illnesses.

badge_template_activities.title: Mental Health First Aid for Youths teaches participants how to identify, understand and respond to signs of mental illness and substance use disorders in youth. Topics covered include anxiety, depression, substance use, disorders in which psychosis may occur, disruptive behavior disorders (including AD/HD), and eating disorders. Participants learn a 5-step action plan for how to help young people in both crisis and non-crisis situations.

Participants engage in dialogue to learn common signs and symptoms of substance use and how to respond. Participants learn how to interact with a child or adolescent in crisis and how to connect the person with the appropriate help.
Participants learn content on trauma, addiction and self-care and the impact of social media and bullying on youth.

Participants learn how to apply the ALGEE Action Plan, which teaches techniques to assess interactions for risk of suicide or harm, listen non-judgmentally, give reassurance and information, encourage appropriate professional help, and encourage other support and self-help strategies.

f84c0cb2-1209-46c5-954f-855bb7131659.description: This four-week program teaches all of the necessities of pitching a stock as well as forecasting a company’s growth. The Merrimack College Stock Pitching and Valuation Badge requires a minimum of 6 hours of training completed over a series of four workshops. Participants will use programs like Bloomberg and Capital IQ to conduct research about a public company to build a completed stock pitch by the end of the workshop series.
f84c0cb2-1209-46c5-954f-855bb7131659.name: Stock Pitching & Valuation: Girard School of Business

badge_template_activities.title: Participants complete a 1.5 hour training on sector, industry, and company analysis. Participants develop the beginning of their company investment pitch, focusing on descriptions, outlooks, and risks. Participants begin to identify the sources they will be using for their research throughout the workshop.

Participants complete a 1.5 hour workshop on competitor analysis and create performance graphs on their company. Participants learn the most important numerical metrics to use for specific sectors. Participants create a competitive analysis table for their company and its competitors. Participants formulate a thesis for their pitch and assess why their company is a good and suitable investment.

Participants complete a 1.5 hour workshop on utilizing valuation models in Excel. At the conclusion of this workshop participants will have a completed Discounted Cash Flow Model and Dividend Growth Model (if applicable) for their company.

Participants complete a 1.5 hour workshop on finalizing their company investment pitch. Participants discover and develop the specific details that should be in the pitch such as (logos, page numbers, fonts, text sizes, etc.) and the formal presenting tips for them to present their pitch sometime in the future. Participants must upload their completed pitches (with speaker notes) to a shared Google Drive folder by the end of this workshop.

695f8915-b4cb-4d4d-ade5-dec851df2fbd.description: Earners of this badge leverage mobile technology by completing five hours of LinkedIn Learning content. Earners are able to effectively manage time, efficiently take notes, quickly share documents, create informative presentations, and set up mobile devices to maximize workflows. Earners also have the opportunity to draw upon their passion for creativity to become better communicators and problem-solvers, preparing them to thrive in today’s world.
695f8915-b4cb-4d4d-ade5-dec851df2fbd.name: Digital Literacy Technologies & Strategies

badge_template_activities.title: Participants personalize devices for maximum efficiency including accessibility functions for vision, physical/motor, hearing, and general features. As an Apple Distinguished School, participants use the iPad to stay organized, manage their day, and collaborate. Native Apple apps and features leveraged include accessibility features, utilizing Today View, security, reminders, scanning and saving documents, sharing files and folders, FaceTime, Coding, Messaging, iCloud, & real-time collaboration.

Participants create and organize notes with note-taking apps, using Apple Pencil. Participants demonstrate knowledge of Apple Pencil through whiteboarding apps and screen recording. Participants manage daily routines and tasks digitally and across devices. Apps include Explain Everything, Screen Record (Apple), Notes, Notability, Google/Apple Calendars, & Scribble.

Compose engaging and interactive presentations that leverage photo, video, and audio to tell a powerful, professional story. Apps leveraged include Canva, Clips, iMovie, Garage Band, Powerpoint, Keynote, and Google Slides.
Share self-designed multimedia projects with peers to enhance the campus learning experience. Choice of apps to create include Camera, Photos, Keynote, Pages, Clips, Apple Pencil, & Garage Band.

bae846b4-8ea2-4fb4-89b3-842b707440d2.description: Earners of this badge have successfully completed Merrimack College's Skills Development Summit, developing necessary skills around career exploration and development, career management and professionalism. Earners can draw upon their strengths, skills, and experiences to articulate a professional brand. They can also align their skills with the needs of potential employers and leverage the assessment of their strengths to communicate their fit for a role.
bae846b4-8ea2-4fb4-89b3-842b707440d2.name: Career Management: Skills Development Summit

alignments.name: NACE Career Readiness Competencies
alignments.description: The National Association of Colleges and Employers, through a task force of college career services and HR/staffing professionals, has developed a definition, based on extensive research among employers, and identified eight competencies associated with career readiness.

badge_template_activities.title: Participants learn the importance of online brand and how employers use a LinkedIn profile for evaluation of potential employees. They learn best practices for a LinkedIn profile, including connection to colleagues and future employers, as well as how to keep profiles engaging, up-to-date and notable.

Participants learn how to format a resume to comply with an Applicant Tracking System (ATS) and to format a resume to attract the attention of a recruiter. Participants use Quinncia to analyze and edit their resumes to ensure they are relevant, concise and reflect top skills and credentials in demand for their future careers.

Participants will learn about and use technology tools for career exploration and development, including AWATO, What Can I Do With This Major, Burning Glass Career Insight and LinkedIn Learning. These tools enable participants to recognize the demand for the career they have chosen to pursue, strategies for pursing that career, identify which skills are necessary for work in the career they have chosen, and identify which skills will increase their future salaries.

Participants will use What Can I Do With This Major, Burning Glass Career Insight and LinkedIn Learning to identify skills and strategies for a skills pursuit plan. Participants identify eight skills and create a three-year action plan with goals to develop those skills for the remainder of their college experience or the beginning of their professional journey. Goals must be specific, measurable, attainable, realistic, and timely action items.

Participants learn best practices for online presence and job-searching in a virtual world. Participants will learn how to translate in-person professional presence to an online professional presence and troubleshoot common technology issues. Participants will also learn best practices for identifying someone for an informational interview, as well as connecting and conducting that interview.

Participants craft talking points for individual strengths that showcase experiences and connect skills and strengths to what employers seek when hiring. Participants leverage technology to conduct virtual interviews using artificial intelligence.

6b143aca-6e83-4d81-80e2-21006f164421.description: Earners of this badge have successfully completed 6 hours of career management training and development through a customized LinkedIn Learning Pathway developed by the Office of Graduate Education at Merrimack College. Earners are able to assess and articulate their career goals, develop a professional resume, and feel confident and prepared for interviews. This badge is awarded to Graduate level students at Merrimack.
6b143aca-6e83-4d81-80e2-21006f164421.name: Career Management: Office of Graduate Education

alignments.name: NACE Career Readiness Competencies
alignments.description: The National Association of Colleges and Employers, through a task force of college career services and HR/staffing professionals, has developed a definition, based on extensive research among employers, and identified eight competencies associated with career readiness.

badge_template_activities.title: Participants learn how to format a resume to comply with an Applicant Tracking System (ATS) and to format a resume to attract the attention of a recruiter. Participants use Quinncia to analyze and edit their resumes to ensure they are relevant, concise and reflect top skills and credentials in demand for their future careers.

Participants will use What Can I Do With This Major to analyze possible career options. Participants will also develop job search strategies, such as how to tap into their professional network, to maximize opportunities and effectiveness in securing a job.

Participants learn best practices for online presence and job-searching in a virtual world. Participants learn the importance of a professional brand and best practices for a LinkedIn profile. They will learn how to translate in-person professional presence to an online professional presence and enhance their social media platforms.

Participants craft talking points for individual strengths that showcase experiences and connect skills and strengths to what employers seek when hiring. Participants are confident and comfortable interviewing both virtually and in-person. Participants use Quinncia to analyze and enhance their interview skills using the virtual mock interview feature.
Participants can conduct research to assess offer letters. They are able to take the appropriate, professional steps in negotiating their compensation package.

873a07d1-2bb9-4932-acfd-cab4c4b5fd24.description: Earners of this badge have successfully completed the Merrimack College Online Cybersecurity asynchronous course. The course consists of 10 videos, assessments, and activities. Participants will develop fundamental skills around browsing safely, protecting information, creating strong passwords, and identifying social engineering attempts. Participants can draw upon the skills learned to keep private information safe and to implement habits that reflect cybersecurity best practices.
873a07d1-2bb9-4932-acfd-cab4c4b5fd24.name: Cybersecurity Essentials

alignments.name: NIST Cybersecurity Framework Core: Protect, Cybersecurity Awareness and Training
alignments.description: The organizations personnel and partners are provided cybersecurity awareness education and are trained to perform cybersecurity related duties and responsibilities consistent with established policies, procedures, and agreements.

badge_template_activities.title: Participants demonstrate their knowledge of their role in preventing cyber attacks by watching the “You Are The Shield” videos and successfully (80/100) completing the quizzes at the end of the video and the mini game: Your Are the Shield - On Call.

Participants define and identify social engineering attempts and categorize each example as phishing or not phishing by watching the “Social Engineering, Phishing, and Email” videos and successfully (80/100) completing the quizzes at the end of the video and the mini game: Email & Phishing: Prevent These Mistakes, Social Engineering - Recognize an Attack.

Participants classify various types of data (PII, sensitive, confidential) by watching the “Safeguarding Information” videos and successfully (80/100) completing the quizzes at the end of the video and the mini games: Browsing Safely - Secure Shopping and Data Security: Weak Links.

Participants categorize strong and weak passwords and articulate ways to maintain privacy online by watching the “Passwords, Best Practices, and Conclusion” videos and successfully (80/100) completing the quizzes at the end of the video and the mini games: Passwords - Password Power and Hacked - Identify a Hack.

a80fb4c6-b32c-4bc5-b170-640c1fe373c0.description: Participants are Merrimack College undergraduate students who engaged in summer research funded by the Sakowich Center for Undergraduate Research and Creative Activities (SCURCA) program. Earners participated in weekly activities related to their respective projects and attended four academic sessions designed to build community and educate students about the research process. Participants gained knowledge about the IRB, library databases, resume building, writing, and research results.
a80fb4c6-b32c-4bc5-b170-640c1fe373c0.name: Undergraduate Research Methods: SCURCA

badge_template_activities.title: Earners completed a 1-hour Institutional Review Board (IRB) academic session. Earners gained an understanding of the IRB and its background. They learned about studies that violated IRB guidelines. They viewed IRB principles and how to apply those principles to their research, and they participated in three case studies.

Earners completed a 1-hour library database research workshop. In this session, students overviewed the following: (1) McQuade Website, (2) LibGuide, (3) MackSearch, (4) Google Scholar, (5) Citation Management, (6) Searching Journals, (7) Streaming Media, and (8) Interloan Library.

Earners completed a 1-hour workshop on ways to incorporate research projects on a resume. The presenter addressed the following resume-related topics: (1) Summaries, (2) Keywords for strong examples, (3) Research and projects, (4) Skills, and (5) Adding SCURCA to your resume.

Earners completed a 1-hour training on how to write research results. In this academic session, earners learned general guidelines for writing up research results by Merrimack professors across various disciplines, and reflected on how they could apply what they learned to write their own SCURCA results.

7f343bc7-fef8-45ec-9099-fea5663b71ee.description: Earners of this badge have engaged in training and coursework to gain foundational health coaching skills. Earners have applied their skills in a practicum course by serving as a coach for clients both on and off Merrimack's campus. Each earner has completed at least 50 health coaching sessions during their practicum experience. Heath Coaches are prepared to work with a range of clients in developing and working toward a wellness vision and helping people achieve their health and wellness goals.
7f343bc7-fef8-45ec-9099-fea5663b71ee.name: Health Coach Certificate

alignments.name: Wellcoaches School of Coaching
alignments.description: Health and well-being coaches partner with clients who are seeking self-directed, lasting changes, aligned with their values, which promote health and wellness and, thereby, enhance well-being. In the course of their work, coaches display unconditional positive regard for their clients and a belief in their capacity for change. Health Coaches focu

alignments.name: Global Wellness Institute: Wellness Coaching Initiative
alignments.description: This paper highlights the current state of health and wellness coaching globally and going forward, what needs to happen for Health and Wellness Coaches to better achieve their potential to meet societal demands globally,by empowering the public to take control in their own health and wellness.

badge_template_activities.title: Participants complete the HSC2500 course focusing on health behavior theories and strategies to promote individuals’ healthy lifestyle. Participants explore and apply theoretically based principles and strategies to real-life cases. Emphasis is placed on understanding of health behaviors in the modern world and design of theory-based interventions to improve health behaviors at the individual, interpersonal and community level.

Participants complete the HSC3353 course focusing on the development of health coaching skills that will advance their health promotion knowledge and skills. Participants advance their content knowledge and health coaching-related skills in the areas of goal setting, motivational interviewing, cultural competence, and effective communication. Participants are prepared to help clients maintain or enhance their health and well-being by supporting the client through behavior change.

Participants complete the HSC4350 course focusing on practicing health coaching skills in the real world setting completing at least 50 health coaching sessions with clients. Participants receive support and feedback from their faculty instructor and their peers. Participants can Demonstrate competency in health coaching, monitor and evaluate their health coaching practice, and use their health coaching skills to support professional aspirations and goals.

def2e90a-601a-480c-a4a0-909c3555f680.description: Earners of this badge have asynchronously completed at least five Civic Engagement modules through Google Classroom created by the Merrimack Institute for New Teacher Support (MINTS). Each module includes videos, activities, assessments, and resource materials for participants. Earners of this badge will demonstrate growth in their careers as civic-minded educators as they reflect on their own learning experiences and create lessons that bring civic engagement into their own classrooms.
def2e90a-601a-480c-a4a0-909c3555f680.name: MINTS: Civic and Community Engagement

badge_template_activities.title: Earners will begin to develop as civic-minded individuals and professionals. Earners will gain knowledge about how to work with their local community and teach their students outside the classroom by using place-based learning (PBL). Earners will be introduced to the different types of PBL using real-world examples and reflect on what might be applicable in their classrooms with their students.

Earners reflect on their experiences with civic engagement in their own K-12 educational experience. Earners develop ways they could bring community, object-based learning, to their roles as educators. Earners learn how other teachers are navigating civic education and politics in a remote learning setting.

Earners will be introduced to the four steps to encourage students critical thinking and introspective reflection. Earners will consider the following two questions: How do you control for ethnocentrism and encourage students to move beyond their own cultural boundaries of understanding? How do you address power imbalances between students and the community?

Earners will learn mechanisms to get students politically and civically involved. Earners will explore strategies for student involvement in a virtual setting through activities such as: showing students how to vote, candidate 'meet and greets', and attending election events.

Earners will explore the importance and the struggles of art education in schools and communities. Earners will gain an understanding of inconsistency and inequitable support for arts education, as well as missed opportunities to strengthen community and build social capital through civic engagement initiatives.

Earners will explore utilizing community partnerships by learning about organizations in the Merrimack Valley and developing strategies for their K-12 school to get involved with these and other organizations in their communities.

Earners will explore the state and federal policies that drive civic engagement. Earners will also discover resources to assist in  navigating their role and responsibilities as educators to the next generation of democratically engaged citizens.

Earners will explore utilizing community partnerships in curricula that connect students with real-world opportunities, and empowers students to learn and grow in the classroom and beyond.  Earners will reflect on what the phrase "community partner" means to them and they will learn how to create a community partner and where to begin.

488dffef-9ba3-4d8c-bead-d7c4b62538c7.description: Earners of this badge are prepared learning assistants (tutors, consultants, etc.) with the fundamental interpersonal skills and professional dispositions necessary to support other learners. This badge is composed of 14 modules, each lasting 30 minutes to 1 hour, covering topics such as active listening, assertiveness, goal setting, critical thinking, ethics, and problem solving. Each module is based on the College Reading and Learning Association Level 1 standards, outcomes, and assessments.
488dffef-9ba3-4d8c-bead-d7c4b62538c7.name: 21st Century Literacy Partners: Learning Assistant Training

alignments.name: College Reading and Learning Association Level 1 Training Standards

badge_template_activities.title: Participants will understand the practical and professional underpinnings of tutoring, including what tutors do, professional expectations, codes of ethics, and compliance with sexual harassment and plagiarism policies. Participants learn these materials in three modules through tutor-training videos created by Merrimack College and Oregon State University. Assessments include worksheets, experiential reflections on prior and current tutoring experiences, and a quiz on ethics and policy.

Participants will develop skills for understanding client needs in four modules addressing nonverbal and intercultural communication, learning styles, universal design approaches, how to be assertive and handle difficult situations, active listening, questioning, and paraphrasing. Assessments for these modules include written short answer explanations of content impact (why and how the skills shape the tutorial), reflections and brainstorming on personal skills implementation, and quizzes.

Participants will learn to shape tutorials around client needs. In three modules, participants will explore how to begin and end a tutorial with impact and empathy, how to role model, and how to help the client set tutorial goals and how to plan a session. Video instruction teaches models and strategies with integrated pauses for students to reflect and answer questions. Assessment involves written short answer strategy development and reflection on success and failures in past practice.

Participants will expand their own approaches to learning and engaging learners through four modules focusing on knowledge growth and critical thinking. These modules teach referral skills for issues beyond the tutorial, study skills, critical thinking, and problem solving. Videos include embedded TEDTalk Productions, models, and strategies to be adapted by the participant. Assessments include skills quizzes, case study responses, and reflections on past and present practice.

Participants must complete all 14 modules with a passing score of at least 80% on all assessments. Assessments are tied to each module and may involve a range of content or reflective responses submitted in quizzes, text, audio, or video files.

bf2d5a18-57c5-45a7-b6d6-e8218bac39da.description: Merrimack College Mental Health First Aid for Adults Certification includes a minimum of 8 hours of training. Mental Health First Aid is a skills-based training course that teaches participants about mental health and substance-use issues. Once complete, participants are registered with the National MHFA program and certification lasts two years.
bf2d5a18-57c5-45a7-b6d6-e8218bac39da.name: Mental Health First Aid - Adult Certification

alignments.name: Research & Evidence Base
alignments.description: Mental Health First Aid is an international training program proven to be effective. Studies also show that the program reduces the social distance created by negative attitudes and perceptions of individuals with mental illnesses.

badge_template_activities.title: Mental Health First Aid for Adults teaches participants how to recognize signs of mental health or substance use challenges in adults ages 18 and older, how to offer and provide initial help, and how to guide a person toward appropriate care if necessary. Participants secure the skills needed to reach out and provide initial support to someone in or approaching crisis and connect them with the appropriate help.

Participants engage in dialogue to learn common signs and symptoms of mental illness and substance use encountered by adults. Participants will be able to enhance their communication skills as they work through scenarios and group conversations to reduce stigmas associated with mental health and substance abuse and use.

Participants learn strategies to recognize the signs and symptoms of mental health or substance use challenges and offer initial support. In addition, participants learn self-help strategies for staying mentally well. Participants also learn how to administer Naloxone in the event of an opioid overdose.

Participants learn how to apply the ALGEE Action Plan, which is how to assess interactions for risk of suicide or harm, listen non-judgmentally, give reassurance and information, encourage appropriate professional help, and encourage other support and self-help strategies.

bb277f1c-fc8b-43b6-953d-cc60756d699c.description: Through a series of workshops, participants experience expert instruction and engage in career development activities utilizing technology tools. From discovering how passions and interests translate to career options to preparing for a first job, co-op, or internship experience, participants leave each workshop with clear, actionable steps that empower their career journey. Participants must complete three of seven core workshops to earn this badge.
bb277f1c-fc8b-43b6-953d-cc60756d699c.name: Career Management & Professionalism

alignments.name: NACE Competencies 2021
alignments.description: Employers responding to National Association of Colleges and Employers Job Outlook surveys have consistently indicated that critical thinking/problem solving, teamwork/collaboration, professionalism/work ethic, and oral/written communications are all essential competencies. The top four competencies have remained consistent the past three years.

badge_template_activities.title: In the "Building your Brand for Networking Success" workshop participants discover and articulate their professional brand, develop and utilize professional skills, as well as help them to grow and employ interpersonal skills. Participants learn about different networking tools and strategies to expand their networking opportunities. Participants enhance their LinkedIn profile using effective tips and tricks that help them stand out to employers and recruiters.

In the "Career Resources and Technology" workshop participants discover how to identify the events, services, and resources offered by the O’Brien Center for Career Development (OCCD) at Merrimack College. Participants learn how various career development experiences can help inform their career pathway. Participants can recognize the importance of experiential learning as a method of career researching. Participants explore the many technology tools and resources available though the OCCD.

In the "Career Exploration" workshop participants discover the connection between values, interests and their future career. Using special career exploration tools participants learn how to recognize the importance of career planning and take action in their career development journey. Participants explore career paths and begin to recognize the importance of skills in the job seeking process.

In the "Cover Letter Writing Success" workshop participants learn tips to creating a cover letter that articulates their skills and experiences while staying connected to the job description. Participants learn how to differentiate between a resume and a cover letter. Participants can identify the purpose of the sections of a cover letter. Participants generate cover letters by formulating content based on specific positions and organizations while highlighting their skills and experiences.

In the "Searching for Jobs/Internships" workshop, participants learn where to search and how to stay organized. Participants discover search strategies, tools, and the hidden job market. Participants are able to recognize the importance of self-knowledge during the job search process and can identify and plan the next steps in their career journey.

In the "Preparing for an Interview workshop, participants discover the tools and strategies they need to ace their next interview. Participants learn how to answer trick questions and can determine which questions they should ask in an interview. Participants learn how to identify different types of questions, including information, behavioral and situational. Participants are able to understand and develop proper interview etiquette to create a good impression.

In the "Resumes: Create and Update" workshop, participants learn how to define a resume and its purpose. Participants can identify the key aspects of a job description to differentiate and develop their resume. Participants resumes can: describe their education, skills, experiences, and measurable achievements using proper grammar, format and brevity. This workshop results in participants having polished resumes that can beat the Applicant Tracking System and get noticed by employers.

7c6760aa-ce63-4af8-8de5-b0bc333c3482.description: Merrimack College Mental Health First Aid for Fire and EMS teaches participants how to identify, understand and respond to signs of mental illnesses and substance use disorders. This 8-hour training teaches methods and techniques to reach out and provide initial support to someone who may be developing a mental health or substance use problem and help connect them to the appropriate care. This course specifically focuses on the unique experiences and needs of firefighters and EMS personnel.
7c6760aa-ce63-4af8-8de5-b0bc333c3482.name: Mental Health First Aid - EMS Certification

alignments.name: Research & Evidence Base
alignments.description: Mental Health First Aid is an international training program proven to be effective. Studies also show that the program reduces the social distance created by negative attitudes and perceptions of individuals with mental illnesses.

badge_template_activities.title: Participants engage in discussion around the first responder culture, stigmas, and their relevance to the topic of mental health. Participants gain a deep understanding of mental health diseases, drug and substance abuse to enhance emergency crisis response.
Participants develop and enhance outreach tactics to respond to individuals experiencing a mental health crisis. Participants learn to adapt and enhance their interpersonal communication skills.

Participants engage in dialogue on the specific risk factors faced by many first responders and their families. Participants discover common mental health resources for first responders, their families, and those who support them.

Participants learn how to apply the ALGEE Action Plan, which teaches techniques to assess interactions for risk of suicide or harm, listen non-judgmentally, give reassurance and information, encourage appropriate professional help, and encourage other support and self-help strategies.

9148b4d0-33b6-49c9-9f22-cd9e61b9ab8d.description: Merrimack College Mental Health First Aid for Higher Education teaches participants how to identify, understand and respond to signs of mental illnesses and substance use disorders. This 8-hour training — which focuses on the unique experiences and needs of college students — teaches participants techniques to reach out and provide initial support to someone who may be developing a mental health or substance use problem and help connect them to the appropriate care.
9148b4d0-33b6-49c9-9f22-cd9e61b9ab8d.name: Mental Health First Aid - Higher Education Certification

alignments.name: Research & Evidence Base
alignments.description: Mental Health First Aid is an international training program proven to be effective. Studies also show that the program reduces the social distance created by negative attitudes and perceptions of individuals with mental illnesses.

badge_template_activities.title: Participants engage in discussion on campus culture and its relevance to the topic of mental health. Mental Health First Aid for Higher Education teaches students, professors and other school faculty how to notice and respond to mental health and addiction challenges commonly experienced by youth in higher education settings.

Participants learn to identify specific stress and risk factors faced by those in higher education. Practicing active listening and communications skills, participants develop action plans in a number of scenarios designed specifically for faculty, administration and students to assist in crisis response.

Participants gain an in-depth review of the mental health resources available on campus and through partnerships in the community and how to help support someone who may be developing a mental health or substance use problem connect with those resources and receive the appropriate care.

Participants learn how to apply the ALGEE Action Plan which teaches techniques to assess interactions for risk of suicide or harm, listen non-judgmentally, give reassurance and information, encourage appropriate professional help, and encourage other support and self-help strategies.

e1d901cf-6e13-40cb-88d4-1ba90b25fecc.description: Merrimack College Mental Health First Aid Public Safety Certification is an 8 hour training where participants learn how to identify, understand, and respond to signs of mental illnesses and substance use disorders. This training teaches participants the techniques to reach out and provide initial support to someone who may be developing a mental health or substance use problem and help connect them to the appropriate care, focusing on the unique experiences and needs of public safety personnel.
e1d901cf-6e13-40cb-88d4-1ba90b25fecc.name: Mental Health First Aid - Public Safety Certification

alignments.name: Research & Evidence Base
alignments.description: Mental Health First Aid is an international training program proven to be effective. Studies also show that the program reduces the social distance created by negative attitudes and perceptions of individuals with mental illnesses.

badge_template_activities.title: Participants - generally law officers and staff- are provided with more response options to help them de-escalate incidents and better understand mental illnesses so they can respond to mental health-related situations and defuse crises appropriately without compromising safety.
Participants engage in group dialog and scenarios to learn about and promoting mental health literacy. The literacy knowledge gained helps participants combat the stigma of mental illness.
Participants learn early intervention strategies through recognition of signs and symptoms.

Participants learn how to apply the ALGEE Action Plan, where they are taught techniques to assess interactions for risk of suicide or harm, listen non-judgmentally, give reassurance and information, encourage appropriate professional help, and encourage other support and self-help strategies.

a1985a25-e4db-4b97-b039-fcf6a0ac57a3.description: The badge earner has demonstrated a beginner-level technical and theoretical understanding of typography, graphic design and two-dimensional layout.
a1985a25-e4db-4b97-b039-fcf6a0ac57a3.name: Merrimack College Design Warrior - Beginner Typography

badge_template_activities.title: Complete and earn LinkedIn Learning Certificate.
Complete and earn LinkedIn Learning Certificate.
Elements of Graphic Design (DES2820). Pass this course and complete projects.

004f1bca-1a58-4576-b0fd-ec1f424945e5.description: Participants who earn this badge are emerging educators that have successfully completed six hours of content related to the foundational skills, knowledge, and strategies needed to begin their careers in education. Participants develop skills in the fundamentals of student learning, engagement, and assessment.
004f1bca-1a58-4576-b0fd-ec1f424945e5.name: Winston School of Education and Social Policy: Classroom Essentials

badge_template_activities.title: Earners complete 2 hours of LinkedIn Learning content on the foundations of student learning objectives and effective teaching practices. Earners explore the Common Core K-12 standards and how to implement them in the classroom. Earners are equipped to design an organized and accurate course syllabus. Earners discover internet-based tools such as video and audio conferencing, learning management systems, and social media, for communicating and developing effective learning objectives.

Earners complete 2 hours of LinkedIn Learning content to develop essential teaching skills, techniques, and strategies. Earners are able to create a classroom culture through the use of classroom management techniques to develop thoughtful learning goals and outcomes that increase achievement and decrease disruption. Earners learn how visual thinking strategies and project-based learning can create equal access to learning resources and opportunities for students.

Earners complete 1 hour of LinkedIn Learning content on measurement and assessment techniques for student learning. Earners learn new models to assist in determining the effectiveness of student learning techniques. Earners discover how to create effective learning assessments that provide valuable feedback to learners and indications on areas of improvement to instructors.

Earners complete 1 hour of LinkedIn Learning content on integrating and implementing technology into the classroom. Earners discover the "flipped classroom" method of technology integration for student learning. Earners can enhance instruction with discussions, activities, and multimedia through digital learning such as Microsoft PowerPoint. Earners are able to effectively transfer instruction from in-person to an online learning environment.

2b3aab41-bdc6-45f8-90b3-eed3107e9172.description: Participants who earn this badge are emerging and experienced educators that have completed eight hours of LinkedIn Learning content dedicated to educational technology and online learning. These trainings give teachers of all levels the tools and strategies needed for student learning, engagement, and assessment in an online environment.
2b3aab41-bdc6-45f8-90b3-eed3107e9172.name: Winston School of Education and Social Policy: Educational Technology

badge_template_activities.title: Earners complete 2-3 hours of LinkedIn Learning content on techniques and strategies for integrating and implementing technology into the classroom. Earners can leverage technology in the classroom to promote engagement, enhance lessons and knowledge retention. Earners discover how to combine instruction with digital resources to create a blended learning environment. Earners understand synchronous learning tools and can design engaging content that connects with a diverse set of learners.

Earners complete 2-3 hours of LinkedIn Learning content on creating engaging online platforms and tools for student learning. Earners can create interactive lessons using Microsoft PowerPoint, social media platforms, and other internet-based platforms. Earners discover how use gamification to set goals for learning and provide multidimensional feedback to learners.

Earners complete 1 hour of LinkedIn Learning content on how to use technology to create assessments for student success. Earners understand how technology can play a critical role in the classroom to promote engagement and student knowledge retention.

Earners discover tools and tips for integrating and implementing technology into the adult-centered classroom. Earners understand the theory behind adult learning. Earners can identify the specific adult-learner needs that must be considered during the instructional design process. Earners are able to rethink their presentation style and redefine their techniques for incorporating Microsoft PowerPoint in the classroom.
